para.sentence: With \psi\left(x\right) denoting the digamma function (ยง5.2(i)) in this subsection, the asymptotic behavior of K\left(k\right) and E\left(k\right) near the singularity at k=1 is given by the following convergent series: K\left(k\right)=\sum_{m=0}^{\infty}\frac{{\left(\tfrac{1}{2}\right)_{m}}{\left (\tfrac{1}{2}\right)_{m}}}{m!\;m!}{k^{\prime}}^{2m}\left(\ln\left(\frac{1}{k^{ \prime}}\right)+d(m)\right), if 0<|k^{\prime}|<1, E\left(k\right)=1+\frac{1}{2}\sum_{m=0}^{\infty}\frac{{\left(\tfrac{1}{2} \right)_{m}}{\left(\tfrac{3}{2}\right)_{m}}}{{\left(2\right)_{m}}m!}{k^{\prime }}^{2m+2}\*\left(\ln\left(\frac{1}{k^{\prime}}\right)+d(m)-\frac{1}{(2m+1)(2m+ 2)}\right), if |k^{\prime}|<1, where d(m)=\psi\left(1+m\right)-\psi\left(\tfrac{1}{2}+m\right),d(m+1)=d(m)-\frac{2}{(2m+1)(2m+2)}, , if m=0,1,\dots, with d(0)=2\ln 2.
For the asymptotic behavior of F\left(\phi,k\right) and E\left(\phi,k\right) as \phi\to\tfrac{1}{2}\pi- and k\to 1- see Kaplan (1948, ยง2),Van de Vel (1969), and Karp and Sitnik (2007).
Asymptotic approximations for \Pi\left(\phi,\alpha^{2},k\right) , with differentvariables, are given in Karp et al. (2007).
They are useful primarily when \ifrac{(1-k)}{(1-\sin\phi)} is either small or large compared with 1.

If x\geq 0 and y>0 , then R_{C}\left(x,y\right)=\frac{\pi}{2\sqrt{y}}-\frac{\sqrt{x}}{y}\left(1+O\left( \sqrt{\frac{x}{y}}\right)\right), if x/y\to 0, R_{C}\left(x,y\right)=\frac{1}{2\sqrt{x}}\left(\left(1+\frac{y}{2x}\right)\ln \left(\frac{4x}{y}\right)-\frac{y}{2x}\right)\*(1+O\left(y^{2}/x^{2}\right)), if y/x\to 0.
